Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.1: Understand the central concepts, tools of inquiry, and structures of the disciplines he or she teaches and can create learning experiences that make these aspects of subject matter meaningful for students.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.2: Understand how children learn and develop, and can provide learning opportunities that support their intellectual, social and personal development.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.3: Understand how students differ in their approaches to learning and creates instructional opportunities that are adapted to diverse learners.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.4: Understand and use a variety of instructional strategies to encourage student’s development of critical thinking, problem solving, and performance skills.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.5: Use an understanding of individual and group motivation and behavior to create a learning environment that encourages positive social interaction, active engagement in learning, and self-motivation.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.6: Use knowledge of effective verbal, nonverbal, and media communication techniques to foster active inquiry, collaboration and supportive interaction in the classroom.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.7: Plan instruction based upon knowledge of subject manner, students, the community, and curriculum goals.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.8: Understand and use formal and informal assessment strategies to evaluate and ensure the continuous intellectual, social and physical development of the learner.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.9: Be a reflective practitioner who continually evaluates the effects of his/her choices and actions on others (students, parents and other professionals in the learning community) and who actively seeks out opportunities to grow professionally.
Agricultural Leadership, Education & Com.10: Foster relationships with school colleagues, parents and agencies in the larger community to support students learning and well-being.
